instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.C7050: What is C7050? Capacitor between current sense lines on ISL6259 chip for battery current sensing, you should measure around 2.202 ohms across this. Often when the resistance across this capacitor is higher it is because one of the current sense resistors going to the ISL6259 chip has failed. When current sensing resistors between the shunt resistor and the ISL6259 power IC have failed the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image
threads.message:
Hello

I've got this board thats chime ok but there is no backlight or image.

pin 1 <CHIP>U9000</CHIP> is 0 v

lvds pin 8-18 diode mode

Pin8 0.620
Pin9 0.620
Pin10 0.000
Pin 11 0.620
Pin12 0.620
Pin13 0.000
Pin 14 0.620
Pin15 0.620
Pin 16 0.000
Pin17 0.620
Pin18 0.620

external monitor works.

any suggestions?

is it <CHIP>U1800</CHIP> that is bad or is it something with lid?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image
threads.message: Have you tried another display assembly?? It is water damage?? if yes inspect LVDS connector if it is evident water damage replace connector first...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image
threads.message: The important pins here are 4 6 and 7. 4 should have 3V and 6 and 7 should check the same on diode measurement. Also make sure <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> is high.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image
threads.message:
No water. Display is working.
I repaired this computer one year ago. Replaced <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> and put a jumperwire between pin 17 and <CAPACITOR>C7050</CAPACITOR>. Then I sold it for 380$. Then I bought it back for 80$ as defect but I didnt know it was the same until i got it home and opend it. The seller said that it worked great for almost a year after she bought it from me.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> is 3.4 v

LVDS
Pin 4 3.3v

Diode
Pin 6 0.620
Pin 7 0.620

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image
threads.message:
Looks ok. Now try with a separate LCD cable and see if pins 4, 6 and 7 make it to the other side. I suspect a bad pin 4 in the connector so no 3V to the EEPROM in the LCD. 
Did you do a PRAM reset just to be sure?
Do you have another LCD assembly to test? 2008-2011 models should all work.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image
threads.message:
I have multiple lcd assemblies but it makes no differense. Tried a separate cable, it was hard to meassure but everyting was ok.

Don't you think it has anything to do with <CHIP>U9000</CHIP> as I have 0v on pin 1, ON.   <SIGNAL>LCD_IG_PWR_EN</SIGNAL> . I have 0 volt on <CHIP>U9000</CHIP> output

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image
threads.message: Pin 2 and 3 on <CHIP>U9000</CHIP> have <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image
threads.message: LCD is not detected. LCD detection is through pins 6 and 7 data bus. Did you measure 6 and 7 with LCD unplugged? What is the resistance between pin 6 and 7?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image
threads.message:
Thanks alot for helping me.

it meassures the same both with and without the lcd connected. resistans between pin 6 and 7 is 4.37k

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image
threads.message: Just did a test here. Diode mode without LCD .615 and LCD plugged in it drops to .560. Better check your readings again. I suspect a bad LCD connector. The 4.4K between the pins is OK.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image
threads.message:
diode lvds unconnected

pin 4 0.349
pin 6 0.614
pin 7 0.613

connected is same.

didn't diode check pin 4 erlier. is it reading to low?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image
threads.message: Pin 4 is fine as long as there is 3V and it will not drop with LCD connected. Pin 4 and 6 should drop if you plug in an LCD. Try other LCD assemblies to see if there is any difference. Try again with just a cable and see if pin4 and 6 come out the other end

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image
threads.message:
Good Morning.

pin 4,6,7 is all 3.3 volt at the loose end with just a cable. Same measurements at connector both with and without lcd connected. when lid is closed i get 0.063v at 4,6,7

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image
threads.message: Lid open or closed should not matter on pin 4 as it is connected to <SIGNAL>3V_S0</SIGNAL>. Check again to be sure. Did you do a PRAM reset?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image
threads.message:
I attatch magsafe, lid closed, fan start spinning, DOONG, 3.3v at pin 4, after a while fan stops, 0,063v at pin 4.
Yes, I did PRAM reset. Tried 5 different LCD that works with other boards.

threads.message:
Are you getting any voltage on <CAPACITOR>C9020</CAPACITOR>? LCD attached lid open of course. I'm running out of ideas on this one.....
Also what caused the original damage around the <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>? Must have been liquid.
